en: The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.
hmr: Upa chun: Dittak Gaia, titakzeta ka ihmangai kuoma chun,

en: Beloved, I pray that in all things thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
hmr: Dittak, i thlarau chun malsâwm- na a hmu angin, iengkima malsâwm- na i hmu le i dam theina dingin ka ṭawngṭai hlak a nih.

en: For I rejoiced greatly, when brethren came and bare witness unto thy truth, even as thou walkest in truth.
hmr: Unauhai hungin, i takzie, (thu- taka i um hlakzie) an mi hung inhriettir lai khan, ka lâwm bêk bêk sih a.

en: Greater joy have I none than this, to hear of my children walking in the truth.
hmr: Ka nauhai thutakah an um ti ka hriet nêka lâwmna nasa lem hrim ka nei nawh.

en: Beloved, thou doest a faithful work in whatsoever thou doest toward them that are brethren and strangers withal;
hmr: Dittak, unauhai mikhuol ni sien- lakhawm, an chunga i thaw ta- phawtah ringumtakin i thaw hlak a;

en: who bare witness to thy love before the church: whom thou wilt do well to set forward on their journey worthily of God:
hmr: chuongchun, kohranhai hmaah i hmangaina an inhriettir tah; anni an inzinnaah Pathien mi ni âwm hrima i ṭhangpui chun ṭhâng a tih;

en: because that for the sake of the Name they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
hmr: a Hming lei chun Jentailhai kuoma inthawkin iengkhawm la loin an suok sih a.

en: We therefore ought to welcome such, that we may be fellow-workers for the truth.
hmr: Chuongchun, thutak thawpuitu- hai ei ni theina dingin chuong ang mi chu eini chun ei lâwm ding a nih.

en: I wrote somewhat unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.
hmr: Kohranhai kuoma khan thu tlâwmtê chu ka ziek tah; nisienla- khawm, Diotrepha, anni laia chung- hnung nuom hlak khan, a mi lâwm si nawh.

en: Therefore, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he doeth, prating against us with wicked words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and them that would he forbiddeth and casteth them out of the church.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka hung chun chu a thilthawhai inhriet suoktir nâwk ka tih, kan chungthu suol hrilin a bautamzie hi; chu khawm chu hun a ti nawh a, ama ngeiin unauhai a lâwm nawh a, a lâwm nuomhai khawm a khap a, kohrana inthawkin a hnawt dawk hlak.

en: Beloved, imitate not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth evil hath not seen God.
hmr: Dittak, suol chu inchûk naw la, ṭhat chu inchûk lem rawh. Thil ṭha thawtu chu Pathiena inthawk a na, thil suol thawtu chun Pathien a hmu ngai nawh.

en: Demetrius hath the witness of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, we also bear witness; and thou knowest that our witness is true.
hmr: Demetri chun mi po po inpâk a hlaw a, thutaka inpâk ngei a hlaw bawk a; anih, keini khawmin kan inpâk a nih; kan inpâkna hi ân dik a nih ti i hriet.

en: I had many things to write unto thee, but I am unwilling to write them to thee with ink and pen:
hmr: I kuomah thu tamtak ziek ding ka nei a, nisienlakhawm, lekhatui le lekhazieknain i kuoma ziek ka nuom nawh a;

en: but I hope shortly to see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be unto thee. The friends salute thee. Salute the friends by name.
hmr: sâwtnawtê hnunga hmu che ka beisei lem a, chuongchun, inhma- tuoin inbieng ei tih.
